1.formula:
=html.7x11("
We engaged with a wide range of potential and actual customers during the development phase, right back from when the product wasn’t fit for purpose.

People who could see Vixo enabling a Service+ proposition were much more likely to give us time, spend their own time working up commercial proposals, taking our product out on the sales circuit with a view to getting a customer to pay us to develop it and so on.

By Service+ we mean a system or application that they can sell bundled with additional services, eg Business Process Re-engineering, or Energy Management.

The focus on building a consolidated partner, developer and reseller channel comes from this experience.
")
1.value:
We engaged with a wide range of potential and actual customers during the development phase, right back from when the product wasn’t fit for purpose.

People who could see Vixo enabling a Service+ proposition were much more likely to give us time, spend their own time working up commercial proposals, taking our product out on the sales circuit with a view to getting a customer to pay us to develop it and so on.

By Service+ we mean a system or application that they can sell bundled with additional services, eg Business Process Re-engineering, or Energy Management.

The focus on building a consolidated partner, developer and reseller channel comes from this experience.

1.formula:
=html.7x11("There are six scenarios shown below. The working scenario we have is called Base Model.

The remaining five show sensitivities to different changes. The changes are:
  • higher service income 
  • lower growth rates
  • higher customer acquisition cost
  • lower average revenue per user
  • higher churn
Click through to examine them and play with them yourself.
")
1.value:
There are six scenarios shown below. The working scenario we have is called Base Model.

The remaining five show sensitivities to different changes. The changes are:
  • higher service income 
  • lower growth rates
  • higher customer acquisition cost
  • lower average revenue per user
  • higher churn
Click through to examine them and play with them yourself.

1.formula: =html.7x11("The target gross margin has remained at 85%+ and the various experiments have been conducted on the basis of proving or disproving that such a gross margin is achievable.")
1.value: The target gross margin has remained at 85%+ and the various experiments have been conducted on the basis of proving or disproving that such a gross margin is achievable.

1.formula:
=html.7x11("
We engaged with a number of customers and did customer discovery with a larger set of potential customers. This process gave us a list of quantified needs.

Overwhelmingly the systems they wanted (and in some cases paid us to build) are lifetime of the company systems – they are not of limited duration or episodic.

The focus on market entry then is on life-time of the company products – which is the basis for the low churn rate in the base model.
")
1.value:
We engaged with a number of customers and did customer discovery with a larger set of potential customers. This process gave us a list of quantified needs.

Overwhelmingly the systems they wanted (and in some cases paid us to build) are lifetime of the company systems – they are not of limited duration or episodic.

The focus on market entry then is on life-time of the company products – which is the basis for the low churn rate in the base model.

1.formula:
=HTML.7X5("
One of the core elements of the discovery phase was measuring the potential value of systems built on top of Vixo.

The bottom level of value is generated by simply eliminating a wage for a software developer. The higher bound is given by a customer who is trying to save £300k to £450k a year using an energy management system built in Vixo.
")
1.value:
One of the core elements of the discovery phase was measuring the potential value of systems built on top of Vixo.

The bottom level of value is generated by simply eliminating a wage for a software developer. The higher bound is given by a customer who is trying to save £300k to £450k a year using an energy management system built in Vixo.

1.formula:
=HTML.7X16("
The pricing proposition is that you can spend £99 a month on vixo or £300 a day on a software developer.

To prove this pricing assumption is true tests were done to demonstrate that not-particularly advanced spreadsheet users could construct sophisticated systems that met their needs without paying software developers.

Having established the pricing bands (£39 a month entry, £99 a month regular, £499 enterprise) we then went through a capability exercise to identify the features and thresholds that would trigger them.

There were a series of performance-related activities undertaken to ensure that the thresholds were appropriately powerful.

A lot of consideration went into the feature set to construct a smooth on-ramp. Free initial trial, enough functionality at the basic price to get customer data on board, a small limit to drive the upgrade to the regular plan.

The regular plan is priced so that is it can be expensed for corporate customers to eliminate the IT department from the buying cycle. The feature set is optimised so that if a corporate user decides to ‘normalise’ their use it will trigger an upgrade to the premium model.
")
1.value:
The pricing proposition is that you can spend £99 a month on vixo or £300 a day on a software developer.

To prove this pricing assumption is true tests were done to demonstrate that not-particularly advanced spreadsheet users could construct sophisticated systems that met their needs without paying software developers.

Having established the pricing bands (£39 a month entry, £99 a month regular, £499 enterprise) we then went through a capability exercise to identify the features and thresholds that would trigger them.

There were a series of performance-related activities undertaken to ensure that the thresholds were appropriately powerful.

A lot of consideration went into the feature set to construct a smooth on-ramp. Free initial trial, enough functionality at the basic price to get customer data on board, a small limit to drive the upgrade to the regular plan.

The regular plan is priced so that is it can be expensed for corporate customers to eliminate the IT department from the buying cycle. The feature set is optimised so that if a corporate user decides to ‘normalise’ their use it will trigger an upgrade to the premium model.

1.formula:
=html.7x15("The business model on this site is a projection.

But it has been constructed via a process of detailed testing. In the development phase of the product we conducted a number of experiments to deepen our understanding of the market place and to test key elements of our proposed business model.

The business model here is the based on the evidence gathered in those experiments.

These experiments have involved about 200 individuals and companies, ranging from customers who have paid substantial sums right the way down to people who gave us their time for interviews.

The experiments ran from when we didn’t have a viable product up through getting cash-flow positive.

The testing techniques varied, including:
  • qualitative surveys
  • quantitative work on costs and utilisation
  • measures of customer and user behaviour and engagement
  • cash payment
The structural approach has been to execute business processes manually to prove and quantify the assumptions underlying them.

This allows us to construct business models with a range of validated sensitivities that we can use to model our work going forward.
")
1.value:
The business model on this site is a projection.

But it has been constructed via a process of detailed testing. In the development phase of the product we conducted a number of experiments to deepen our understanding of the market place and to test key elements of our proposed business model.

The business model here is the based on the evidence gathered in those experiments.

These experiments have involved about 200 individuals and companies, ranging from customers who have paid substantial sums right the way down to people who gave us their time for interviews.

The experiments ran from when we didn’t have a viable product up through getting cash-flow positive.

The testing techniques varied, including:
  • qualitative surveys
  • quantitative work on costs and utilisation
  • measures of customer and user behaviour and engagement
  • cash payment
The structural approach has been to execute business processes manually to prove and quantify the assumptions underlying them.

This allows us to construct business models with a range of validated sensitivities that we can use to model our work going forward.

1.formula: =html.7x11("The cost model has come from measuring actual costs from our customer implementations. Measuring and understanding costs has led us to focus on certain product types that have both lower direct costs relative to value and also don’t force us to incur engineering costs in the short term.")
1.value: The cost model has come from measuring actual costs from our customer implementations. Measuring and understanding costs has led us to focus on certain product types that have both lower direct costs relative to value and also don’t force us to incur engineering costs in the short term.
